original: The use of small molecule modulators of protein kinases has significantly advanced the understanding of protein phosphorylation and its biological implications. Notably, both nonselective and selective kinase inhibitors, including a class of pyridinylimidazole compounds, serve as potent tools for dissecting mitogen-activated protein (MAP) kinase signaling pathways. These pyridinylimidazole compounds operate by targeting the ATP binding
